attributes.action: Introduction of National Letter Box Standards
attributes.additional_details:
From a political cross party perspective how many campaigners have been bitten whilst posting letters/campaign materials? I know of three from the most recent local election alone. 

We the undersigned would also like to see a uniform approach taken to any new developments in the UK – ensuring that letterboxes are approximately midway and horizontal on the door, creating an easier route for postal workers, deliverers, and campaigners alike.
attributes.background: Our posties lack the protections they need to carry out their duties unimpeded. We are calling for the introduction of national letter box standards. Dog owners must have either a letter cage affixed to the reverse of their door, or an external post box to ensure the safety of all delivery workers.

rejection.details: Not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. The UK Parliament and Government are not responsible for the size of letter boxes.
